CONGRATS RHS Class of 2020 Grad Michelle Garcia!!

The Roma High School Girl’s Basketball Program would like to congratulate Class of 2020 graduate Michelle Garcia for being selected for the Texas A&M International University Women’s Basketball Team!

“Michelle is an excellent student athlete who is committed to whatever she sets out to accomplish,” said RHS Girl’s Varsity Basketball Coach Morales. “We are extremely proud of the hard work she put into transitioning from her role as a Lady Gladiator to now playing with the TAMIU Lady Dustdevils. She will be a wonderful addition to their team and be a real role model for her younger peers at Roma High. Playing at the NCAA level is something few high school athletes accomplish so this is a real honor for her and our program. Congrats Michelle! We will continue to be rooting for you.”

Student Devices Update:

Roma ISD has a majority of the student devices in, but some are still in the mail with more shipments expected this week. In the mean time staff are working around the clock to get devices ready to be distributed.

“This is a monumental task for a district our size to procure and get these iPads and Chromebooks ready for our students, requiring a huge effort in time and manpower by our staff,” said Superintendent Carlos Guzman. “I ask for parents to be patient as we process these devices and start getting them out in the community later this week and weekend. Please know that we can not control shipping of these devices and are waiting in line with other districts for our orders. We will do everything possible to get these devices in the hands of students by day one of class. In the mean time I have to sincerely thank everyone working long hours to make this tremendous work possible!”

Roma ISD is mourning the loss of Mr. Jaime Ramirez, a dedicated Gladiator who served in the Roma ISD Transportation Department, who passed away this afternoon. Mr. Ramirez always showed up ready and willing to work until the job was done. He was no stranger to long hours, but loved his job because he loved the children that were trusted in his care. He understood the great responsibility of working in Transportation and was always willing to go the extra mile. His smile, laugh and kind nature made him a joy to be around. Mr. Ramirez will be greatly missed by his colleagues and the children he served. Condolences from The Gladiator Nation Community to his family.

“Dependable, reliable, trustworthy, a friend - those are words I would use to describe Mr. Ramirez,” said Roma ISD Transportation Director Rick Esparza. “This is a huge loss for us in our department and for the children of Roma ISD. It was an honor and privilege to call him a partner on this team.”

Rest In Peace Mr. Ramirez.

Big thanks to the Roma ISD Federal Programs Department led by Mrs. Mary Lou Cruz for helping to secure a ESSER: Elementary and Secondary School Emergency Relief Grant that will cover virtual school supplies for every teacher at Roma ISD!

Authorized by the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act, 428 Roma ISD teachers will receive $400 each to cover items needed for online teaching including white boards, screens, cameras, phone stands to record themselves, or other related items on an approved list of supplies.

“We are so happy to have secured this extra funding and really have to thank Mrs. Cruz for her leadership in helping to secure and manage these funds, as well as her work with our principals to identify areas of need that can most help our teachers,” said Roma ISD Superintendent Carlos Guzman. “Usually we are only able to give our teachers $100 for supplies so this $300 increase is a huge help.”

In all, through the grant, the district will provide teachers $171,200 for digital supplies this school year.

CONGRATULATIONS to the members of the Roma High School Choir who participated in the UIL Solo & Ensemble Contest on Saturday, January 25, 2020, at Economedes High School in Edinburg, Texas. Each student prepared a vocal solo and performed it by memory in front of an adjudicator who rated each performance with a rating of 1-5, with 1 being the best rating possible. Additionally an ensemble group of 8 students performed a piece together as a group for a rating. A total of 16 students received a 1st division rating of “Superior” for their solos and 8 students received a 2nd division rating of “Excellent” for their solos. The ensemble group received a 1st division rating of “Superior”.

A total of 11 solos and the ensemble group now advance to the Texas State Solo & Ensemble Contest (TSSEC) that will take place at the University of Texas at Austin on June 1.

Congratulations to these fine student musicians, their proud parents, and their dedicated directors Alicia Pena and Miguel Martinez.

(Information courtesy Dr. Adrian Guerra.)

post_text: We are so proud of our F. J. Scott Elementary School Knights for bringing joy to the folks at the Starr County Pct. 2 Nutrition Center under the direction of Commissioner Raul “Roy” Pena III. Thanks to Elias Alaniz for working to help bring this project together for the community!
shared_text:
Starr County Texas added 48 new photos to the album: F.J. Scott Elem Knights Dance Krew visit Nutrition Center.
December 19, 2019 at 3:18 PM ·

Santa sent F.J. Scott"s KDK Dance Group Helpers to Roma Nutrition Center to deliver special gifts

The Senior Citizens that attend Starr County Pct. 2 Nutrition Center under the direction of Commissioner Raul “Roy” Pena III, were treated to a performance by the FJ Scott Elementary Dance Group.
After graciously dancing with snowflake effects, the children presented each of the members who was present at the center with a beautifully decorated Christmas Tree. Commissioner Raul “Roy” Pena, III was also happy to accept Christmas Trees to be delivered to the members who were not able to attend.
Thank You Coach Elias Alanis Solis and the Knight Dance Krew (KDK) Dance Team for such a wonderful Christmas Surprise
